comments.html:
@Simon: You're absolutely right, but I wasn't able to find per-product line numbers. Cisco is reporting sales per product segment, but not the associated expenses, and most other companies aren't even that forthcoming. This back-of-the-napkin calculation was thus the best I could do, and as Anonymous pointed out, most companies would have to do R&D in most product categories they carry.

Also, the difference is significant - Cisco (without acquisitions) is spending twice as much on R&D as HP with less than half their sales volume.
